IF UNDER RAVP AN ACFT OR VEHICLE REPORTS ANOTHER ACFT/VEHICLE IN SIGHT OR BEING ABLE TO FOLLOW, SEPARATION BY ATC IS TERMINATED AND THE PILOT/VEHICLE DRIVER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING AN APPROPRIATE TAXI DISTANCE AT OWN DISCRETION. ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

THIS SYSTEM IS ACT EVEN BY THE SLIGHTEST XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR AND ALERTS THE PILOT. FST, THE ACFT APPROACHING THE CAT II/III HLDG PSN IS DETECTED BY A MICROWAVE SENSOR SYSTEM. IN CASE OF AN UNAUTHORISED XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR, FOUR VERY BRIGHT, FLG RED SFC LGT AT THE CAT I HLDG PSN AS WELL AS TWO RED LGT EACH ON BOTH SHOULDERS OF TWY BTN THE CAT I AND CAT II/III HLDG PSN ARE ACT. THE LGT IS DIRECTED TOWARDS THE PILOT AND THUS ALERTS THE PILOT OF AN IMMINENT RWY INCURSION. IN ADDN, THE ATC TWR CONTROLLERS ARE ALERTED

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
MILITARY TRAFFIC WITH DEPARTURE OR DESTINATION ETNG OVERFLYING EHAA FIR SHALL FILE A GAT FLIGHT PLAN, FILED IN ACCORDANCE WITH AIP THE NETHERLANDS SECTION ENR 1.10 AND ACKNOWLEDGED BY IFPS.
DUTCH MIL INFO FREQ 132.350 MHZ LIMITED COVERAGE IN THE NORTH WESTERN PART OF THE NETHERLANDS.

FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. Paragraph.Text: AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.

Paragraph.Text: SX0011/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY:06DEC24 - UFN TRAFFIC ENTERING TRIPOLI FIR FROM CAIRO FIR AND NDJAMENA FIR . -DETAILS:- ALL TRAFFIC ENTERING TRIPOLI FIR FROM CAIRO FIR AND NDJAMENA FIR SHALL TRY TO CONTACT THE FOLLOWING FREQUENCIES NOT LESS THAN 10 MINUTES PRIOR TO ENTERING TRIPOLI FIR AS FOLLOWS: 1.TRAFFIC FROM CAIRO FIR VIA LOSUL SHALL CONTACT TOBRUK TWR ON VHF 118.5 MHZ. 2.TRAFFIC FROM CAIRO FIR VIA DITAR SHALL CONTACT KUFRA TWR ON VHF 121.9 MHZ. 3.TRAFFIC FROM NDJAMENA FIR VIA TONBA SHALL CONTACT KUFRA TWR ON VHF 121.9 MHZ. 4.TRAFFIC FROM NDJAMENA FIR VIA GARIN,TUMMO AND DEKTU SHALL CONTACT SEBHA TWR ON VHF 119.1 MHZ. REMARK: IN ADDITION TO THE PREVIOUS FREQUENCIES ALL FLIGHTS INTEND TO OPERATE WITHIN TRIPOLI FIR CAN CONTACT TRIPOLI INFORMATION ON HF 11300 KHZ AND 5517 KHZ.
